interventions.original_text: pure essential oils of lavender, bergamot, and cedarwood administered by inhalation

metadata.purpose: to determine whether the inhalation of aromatherapy during radiotherapy reduces anxiety.
metadata.conclusion: aromatherapy, as administered in this study, is not beneficial.

metadata.purpose: to investigate the extraction of cedarwood oil using liquid carbon dioxide and compare it to supercritical fluid extraction.
metadata.conclusion: the extraction rate of cedarwood oil was highest under supercritical extraction conditions, and the chemical composition varied with temperature and pressure, affecting the cedrol/cedrene ratio.

metadata.purpose: to explore the synthesis and sensory aspects of new molecules derived from cedarwood and turpentine oil for fragrance applications.
metadata.conclusion: the study highlights the potential of using renewable resources like cedarwood oil to synthesize new molecules with excellent olfactory properties, such as ambrocenide, which can be developed from alpha-cedrene.

metadata.purpose: to identify odor-active compounds in the spicy fraction of hop essential oil from four different varieties.
metadata.conclusion: an intense 'woody, cedarwood' odor was determined to be the most potent odorant in three of the four spicy fraction samples, tentatively identified as 14-hydroxy-beta-caryophyllene.

metadata.purpose: to summarize the talk at the rsc/sci conference 'flavours & fragrances 2007' and present new experimental results on woody odorants.
metadata.conclusion: the study presents new insights into the structure-odor correlation of spirocyclic hydroxy ketone analogs and highlights stereochemical requirements for woody odorants.

metadata.purpose: to study the antibacterial activity of nine commercially available essential oils against streptococcus mutans in vitro and to compare the antibacterial activity between each material.
metadata.conclusion: cinnamon oil showed highest activity against streptococcus mutans followed by lemongrass oil and cedarwood oil. the use of these essential oils against s. mutans can be a viable alternative to other antibacterial agents.

metadata.population: third instars of cecidomyiid gall midge camptomyia corticalis
metadata.purpose: to examine the toxicity of 98 plant essential oils against third instars of cecidomyiid gall midge camptomyia corticalis using a vapor-phase mortality bioassay.
metadata.conclusion: all essential oils were less toxic than dichlorvos, with virginian cedarwood oil having an lc50 between 0.61 and 0.99 mg/cm3, indicating potential as a larvicide for c. corticalis control.

metadata.purpose: to describe the use of cedarwood oil as a complementary treatment in refractory acne.
metadata.conclusion: the addition of cedarwood oil was helpful in controlling acne in a patient with refractory acne.

metadata.population: studies on the repellency effects of plants against anopheles mosquitoes
metadata.purpose: to assess the effectiveness of plant-based repellents against anopheles mosquitoes
metadata.conclusion: essential oils and extracts of some plants, including cedarwood, showed good repellency with 8 hours complete repellency against different species of anopheles.

metadata.purpose: to investigate the inter-specific variability effect on the biological activities of each oil.
metadata.conclusion: the tested oils possessed good antibacterial activities against e.coli and s. aureus justifying its folk use as a topical antiseptic while the observed anti-inflammatory effects in human wbcs is due at least in part to their inhibitory effect on the production of pro-inflammatory cytokines.

metadata.population: patients with inflammatory skin conditions such as acne vulgaris, dermatitis, eczema, psoriasis, and rosacea
metadata.purpose: to generate a broad overview of the essential oils used to treat inflammatory skin conditions in a clinical setting
metadata.conclusion: the uncontrolled studies indicated the potential efficacy of cedarwood (cedrus libani) oil in the treatment of acne, but further research is required to reach conclusive evidence.

interventions.original_text: massaged essential oils (thyme, rosemary, lavender, and cedarwood) in a mixture of carrier oils (jojoba and grapeseed) into their scalp daily

metadata.purpose: to investigate the efficacy of aromatherapy in the treatment of patients with alopecia areata.
metadata.conclusion: the results show aromatherapy to be a safe and effective treatment for alopecia areata. treatment with these essential oils was significantly more effective than treatment with the carrier oil alone (p = .008 for the primary outcome measure).

metadata.purpose: to search for xanthine oxidase inhibitors in natural products obtained from plants collected in puerto rico and to assess the influence of these extracts in the prevention of cataractogenesis.
metadata.conclusion: eucalyptus deglupta presented the best finding for cataractogenesis prevention, while syzygium malaccense demonstrated the greatest xanthine oxidase inhibitory activity.

metadata.population: wood samples from two eucalyptus species of various ages and colors
metadata.purpose: to examine the feasibility of using fourier transform raman spectroscopy for rapid determination of proportion of cell types in native wood.
metadata.conclusion: fourier transform raman spectroscopy, combined with second derivative transformation and partial least-squares regression, provides highly significant correlations with microscopically measured values for determining cell type proportions in eucalyptus wood.

metadata.population: children with acute maxillary sinusitis, exacerbation of chronic purulent maxillary sinusitis and peritonsillar abscess
metadata.purpose: to evaluate the antiinflammatory effect of eucalymine in children with acute inflammatory ent diseases
metadata.conclusion: eucalymine shows a good antiinflammatory effect and can be used as a treatment of choice in children with ent diseases.

metadata.purpose: to measure the penetration of solar erythemal ultraviolet radiation in the shade of a gum (eucalyptus sp.) and a she oak (casaurina) tree.
metadata.conclusion: the denser foliage of the she oak provided higher ultraviolet protection compared to that of the gum tree.

metadata.purpose: to update on human defenses against cryptococcus neoformans, focusing on immune responses and susceptibility in aids patients.
metadata.conclusion: susceptibility of aids patients to cryptococcus neoformans is associated with low cd4+ t cell counts and likely reduced efficacy of the second line of defense.

metadata.purpose: to compare the antibacterial activity of australian tea tree oil with various other essential myrtaceous oils including eucalyptus oil.
metadata.conclusion: eucalyptus oil was tested for antibacterial activity against various bacteria using a broth microdilution method, but pseudomonas aeruginosa was resistant to all essential oils tested, even at the highest concentration of 4%.

interventions.original_text: absorption of several of these oils for therapeutic purposes

metadata.purpose: to report cases of seizures related to the absorption of plant-derived essential oils, including eucalyptus, for therapeutic purposes.
metadata.conclusion: the study reports three cases of seizures related to the absorption of plant-derived essential oils, including eucalyptus, highlighting the potential for these oils to cause toxic seizures.

metadata.population: eucalyptus pilularis and pisolithus tinctorius ectomycorrhizas
metadata.purpose: to analyze the distribution of polyphosphate in fungal vacuoles of ectomycorrhizas between pisolithus tinctorius and eucalyptus pilularis.
metadata.conclusion: polyphosphate is present in the vacuoles of the fungal cells of these ectomycorrhizas in a dispersed form, not in granules.

metadata.population: patients with superficial fungal infections diagnosed as tinea pedis, tinea corporis, or tinea cruris
metadata.purpose: to investigate the antifungal activity of eucalyptus pauciflora oil against superficial fungal infections
metadata.conclusion: the eucalyptus pauciflora oil showed strong antifungal activity in vitro and was effective in treating superficial fungal infections in patients, with 60% recovering completely and 40% showing significant improvement.

interventions.original_text: a diet containing a mixture of terpenes found in eucalyptus leaves

metadata.purpose: to study the induction of xenobiotic metabolising enzymes in the common brushtail possum by eucalyptus terpenes.
metadata.conclusion: dietary terpenes cause enzyme induction in folivorous marsupials, confirming the importance of diet knowledge when studying xenobiotic metabolising enzymes in wild animals like the brushtail possum.

interventions.original_text: 125 ml of a 20 per cent eucalyptus compositum solution

metadata.purpose: to compare three management programmes for improving reproductive performance in a dairy herd with endometritis.
metadata.conclusion: management programmes based on the strategic use of PGF2alpha are an effective alternative to traditional programmes based on rectal palpations and intrauterine infusions to control endometritis at a herd level.

metadata.purpose: to study the influence of various extraction parameters on the yield and qualitative composition of lipids extracted from eucalyptus globulus wood using supercritical carbon dioxide modified with methanol.
metadata.conclusion: the qualitative and quantitative results obtained by supercritical carbon dioxide extraction and soxhlet extraction with acetone were in good agreement.

metadata.population: patients with dermatological conditions using herbal treatments
metadata.purpose: to address the adverse effects of herbal drugs in dermatology in a semisystematic fashion
metadata.conclusion: adverse effects of herbal medicines are an important albeit neglected subject in dermatology, which deserves further systematic investigation.

metadata.population: humans and warm-blooded animals with cryptococcosis
metadata.purpose: to investigate the etiological agents of cryptococcosis and their environmental sources
metadata.conclusion: cryptococcus neoformans, particularly variety gattii, is associated with eucalyptus trees and causes cryptococcosis in humans and animals, with a geographical distribution in tropical and subtropical regions.

metadata.population: eucalyptus grandis hill ex maiden stand in brazil
metadata.purpose: to compare the efficiency of different trap types for ambrosia beetles in eucalyptus stands in brazil.
metadata.conclusion: the esalq-84 trap was the most efficient in trapping hypothenemus eruditus and hypothenemus obscurus, while the slot trap caught more of the three most economically important scolytid species in eucalypt plantations in brazil.

metadata.purpose: to highlight the global cultivation and uses of eucalyptus, including timber, fuel, essential oil, and cut foliage.
metadata.conclusion: eucalyptus is a widely cultivated tree, covering ten million hectares worldwide, and is valued for its timber, fuel, essential oil, and cut foliage.

metadata.purpose: to investigate tolbutamide hydroxylase as a probe substrate reaction in koala and brushtail possum liver microsomes and examine inhibition by eucalyptus terpenes.
metadata.conclusion: 1,8-cineole was found to be a competitive inhibitor for the enzyme responsible for tolbutamide hydroxylation in the possum, while in koala liver microsomes, stimulation of tolbutamide hydroxylase activity was observed with increased cineole concentrations.

metadata.population: koalas (phascolarctos cinereus) including 5 pouched young and 10 adults
metadata.purpose: to analyze the anatomy and development of koalas from an evolutionary perspective on the superfamily vombatoidea.
metadata.conclusion: musculoskeletal structures correlated with sitting and climbing; the growth of the young and the physiological demands of adulthood correlated with the low-quality diet of eucalyptus foliage.

metadata.purpose: to compare two instruments for measuring rates of leaf decay using biological oxygen demand.
metadata.conclusion: decay measurements obtained by both instruments were nearly identical for casuarina cunninghamiana and eucalyptus polyanthemos, indicating the feasibility of using both instruments for comparable measurements of leaf decay rates.

metadata.purpose: to compare the major components of eucalyptus camaldulensis oils obtained by hydrodistillation and supercritical carbon dioxide extraction.
metadata.conclusion: the oil obtained by hydrodistillation showed high concentrations of 1,8-cineole, alpha-pinene, beta-pinene, p-cymene, terpinen-4-ol, and globulol, while supercritical carbon dioxide extraction resulted in lower amounts of these components but higher amounts of allo-aromadendrene and globulol.

synergies_interactions_negative: 1,8-cineole inhibited 1,4-cineole 2-hydroxylation catalysed by human liver microsomes
metadata.purpose: to study the oxidation of 1,4-cineole by rat and human liver microsomes and recombinant cytochrome p450 enzymes.
metadata.conclusion: 1,4-cineole and 1,8-cineole are converted to 2-hydroxylated products by cyp3a enzymes in rat and human liver microsomes.

metadata.population: energy crops including salix viminalis and eucalyptus nitens
metadata.purpose: to investigate the spatial root distribution of energy crops in response to dairy farm pond effluent irrigation.
metadata.conclusion: spatial root distribution was influenced by effluent rate, with greater quantities of both fine and coarse roots in the top soil horizons with the higher effluent rate of 300 m3 ha(-1) compared to 150 m3 ha(-1).

metadata.purpose: to compare the raman spectra of dragon's blood resins from different botanical sources and identify key vibrational spectroscopic marker bands for identification purposes.
metadata.conclusion: key vibrational spectroscopic marker bands are identified in the raman spectra of the resins, which are suggested for adoption as a protocol for the identification of the botanical and possible geographical sources of modern dragon's blood resins.

metadata.purpose: to determine the required hlb values of eucalyptus, lippia, and peppermint essential oils using droplet size analysis and turbidimetric method.
metadata.conclusion: the required hlb values of eucalyptus, lippia, and peppermint oils were determined as 9.8, 12.1, and 12.3, respectively, using droplet size analysis and turbidimetric method.

metadata.purpose: to examine the metabolism of p-cymene by liver microsomes from the possum, koala, and rat.
metadata.conclusion: animals adapted to a diet of eucalyptus leaf have a greater capacity to metabolize dietary terpenes than generalist feeders.

metadata.population: standardized samples of root canal sealers

interventions.original_text: immersed in chloroform or eucalyptus oil for 30 seconds, 1 minute, 2 minutes, 5 minutes, 10 minutes, and 20 minutes

metadata.purpose: to compare the solubility of different root canal sealers in chloroform and eucalyptus oil
metadata.conclusion: under the conditions of this study, chloroform was a far more effective solvent of root canal sealers than eucalyptus oil.

metadata.population: human participants in vaca diez province, bolivian amazon
metadata.purpose: to evaluate the efficacy of three plant-based insect repellents against malaria vectors in bolivia.
metadata.conclusion: the eucalyptus-based repellent containing 30% p-menthane-diol provided 96.89% protection against anopheles darlingi for 4 hours, outperforming 15% deet which provided 84.81% protection.

metadata.purpose: to understand the dynamics of cryptococcus neoformans var. gattii in australian environments using koalas as natural biological samplers.
metadata.conclusion: a strong association between healthy koalas and cryptococcus neoformans var. gattii was confirmed, and the organism was isolated from novel sources, including eucalyptus microcorys and e. grandis.

interventions.original_text: natural oil formulations (containing citronella, clover, eucalyptus, geranium, lavender, peppermint, sandalwood, thyme, etc.)

metadata.purpose: to compare the repellent activity of natural oil formulations and a synthetic chemical repellent against aedes aegypti.
metadata.conclusion: natural oil products, including those containing eucalyptus, showed poor or no repellency against aedes aegypti, with protection times less than or equal to 1 hour. only the synthetic repellent based on kbr 3023 provided satisfactory defense to human volunteers.

metadata.population: eucalyptus short rotation forest species irrigated with meatworks effluent compared with no irrigation
metadata.purpose: to measure biomass and nutrient accumulation in eucalyptus short rotation energy forests in new zealand
metadata.conclusion: eucalyptus globulus had the highest biomass and nutrient accumulation, with effluent irrigation increasing the accumulation of biomass, n, p, k, and mn, but reducing the leaf area index and leaf biomass, and decreasing the accumulation of ca and mg.

metadata.purpose: to demonstrate that the vascular expression pattern conferred by the eucalyptus gunnii egcad2 promoter is conserved among woody and herbaceous plant species.
metadata.conclusion: the mechanisms controlling developmental and wounding inducible expression of the egcad2 promoter are conserved among perennial woody and annual herbaceous plant species.

metadata.population: common ringtail (pseudocheirus peregrinus) and common brushtail possums (trichosurus vulpecula)
metadata.purpose: to study the effect of tannins and formylated phloroglucinol compounds on the intake of eucalyptus foliage by common ringtail and common brushtail possums.
metadata.conclusion: brushtail possums showed greater tolerance to formylated phloroglucinol compounds and ate more foliage when coated with polyethylene glycol, while ringtail possums were tolerant of tannins but susceptible to low concentrations of formylated phloroglucinol compounds.

metadata.purpose: to evaluate the anti-inflammatory efficacy of 1.8-cineol by determining its prednisolone equivalent potency in patients with severe asthma.
metadata.conclusion: long-term systemic therapy with 1.8-cineol has a significant steroid-saving effect in steroid-dependent asthma, suggesting an anti-inflammatory activity of the monoterpene 1.8-cineol in asthma.

metadata.population: mosquitoes consisting mainly of mansonia in gambella, western ethiopia
metadata.purpose: to evaluate the repellent activity of essential oils of lemon eucalyptus and other plant products against mosquito populations in western ethiopia
metadata.conclusion: the essential oil of lemon eucalyptus showed significant repellent activity at 40% and 75% concentrations, with better performance at 75% compared to pyrethrum and neem.

metadata.purpose: to estimate the level of exposure of children under the age of 18 to second-hand smoke inside motor vehicles.
metadata.conclusion: the rate of child exposure to second-hand smoke is very high, indicating a need for campaigns to prevent smoking tobacco inside motor vehicles in the presence of children in spain.

metadata.population: patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease caused by biomass and tobacco smoke
metadata.purpose: to determine clinical differences between copd caused by biomass smoke and copd caused by tobacco smoke.
metadata.conclusion: differences were observed between copd caused by biomass and copd caused by tobacco smoke, although these may be attributed in part to uneven gender distribution between the groups.

metadata.population: individuals at risk of cardiovascular disease
metadata.purpose: to review developments in 2013 related to cardiovascular disease prevention, including diet, weight control, physical activity, smoking, genetics, and cardiac rehabilitation.
metadata.conclusion: the article reviews developments in cardiovascular disease prevention, highlighting the importance of early detection, lifestyle modifications, and pharmacological approaches, with updates on guidelines for hypertension, diabetes mellitus, and chronic kidney disease.

metadata.purpose: to investigate animal models of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and their ability to represent the disease and its components.
metadata.conclusion: continuous, long-term exposure to cigarette smoke is considered the main risk factor for chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, and the cigarette smoke exposure model is the most widely used in animal studies.

metadata.purpose: to review recent updates in vascular risk and cardiac rehabilitation, including diet, exercise, smoking, lipids, hypertension, diabetes mellitus, and cardiac rehabilitation.
metadata.conclusion: the review highlights the challenges in achieving good risk factor control in various areas such as diet, exercise, smoking, lipids, hypertension, and diabetes mellitus, and emphasizes the need for tailored treatment criteria for elderly patients.

metadata.population: people with a genetic predisposition to multiple sclerosis
metadata.purpose: to review the effects of environmental risk factors on epigenetic mechanisms in the development of multiple sclerosis
metadata.conclusion: knowledge of epigenetic modifications involved in the pathogenesis of multiple sclerosis opens a new avenue of research for identification of potential biomarkers and new therapeutic targets.

metadata.purpose: to estimate the mortality attributable to smoking and its impact on premature mortality in spain in the year 2012
metadata.conclusion: in 2012, smoking caused 60,456 deaths which accounted for 15.23% of all deaths in spain. trachea-bronchial-lung cancer in men and other cardiopathies in women mostly contributed to this mortality.

metadata.purpose: to investigate the characteristics associated with squamous cell carcinoma meeting the high-risk criteria defined by the ajcc for t2 lesions
metadata.conclusion: advanced age, location in the head and neck region, presence of solar elastosis, high tumor growth rate, and high cumulative smoking exposure were all significantly associated with the presence of scc t2.

metadata.purpose: to estimate the prevalence of smoking in workers from hospitals within the catalan network for smoke-free hospitals from 2009 to 2012 according to workers' sociodemographic characteristics and the type of hospital.
metadata.conclusion: the overall prevalence of smoking was 28.1% with physicians having the lowest prevalence at 16.4%. smoking cessation should be promoted among other professional groups.

metadata.purpose: to review the evidence on the implications of smoking bans in mental health care settings.
metadata.conclusion: evidence shows that smoking has no place in psychiatric hospitals or facilities, and the introduction of smoking bans in psychiatric settings is possible as part of a larger strategy to reduce smoking rates among mental health populations.

metadata.purpose: to provide a current and practical overview about hidradenitis suppurativa to optimize healthcare for patients.
metadata.conclusion: primary care physicians play an important role in the early diagnosis and management of hidradenitis suppurativa.

metadata.purpose: to present an updated review on the relationship between urological disease and tobacco consumption and the importance of involving urologists in smoking prevention.
metadata.conclusion: urologists play an essential role in informing patients of the relationship between smoking and urological disease. it is the duty of every urologist to play a more active role in educating patients and promoting smoking cessation.

metadata.purpose: to discuss the challenges and achievements in smoking control and the role of pulmonologists in treating smokers and supporting anti-smoking policies.
metadata.conclusion: smoking control policies and treatment resources for smoking cessation have advanced in recent years, showing highly satisfactory results, particularly in brazil, but there is still a long way to go before smoking can be considered a controlled disease from a public health standpoint.

metadata.purpose: to highlight the need to shed light on thirdhand smoke and incorporate it into the public health debate.
metadata.conclusion: thirdhand smoke consists of residual pollutants from cigarette smoke that remain in environments and poses a health risk due to the presence and persistence of toxic compounds, including carcinogenic nitrosamines.

metadata.population: individuals from the national longitudinal study of adolescent to adult health
metadata.purpose: to compare the fit of different binary models for correlated data in tobacco use
metadata.conclusion: people were less likely to smoke if they had higher income, high school or higher education and were religious, while individuals were more likely to smoke if they had abused drugs or alcohol, spent more time on tv and video games, been arrested, or drank alcohol early in life.

metadata.purpose: to review the impact of cannabis consumption on the lungs.
metadata.conclusion: the components of smoke from combustion of marijuana are similar to those produced by the combustion of tobacco, but they differ in terms of psychoactive components and use.

metadata.purpose: to establish evidence based guidelines to advise patients on the relationship between habits, diet, certain circumstances, diseases and glaucoma
metadata.conclusion: the studies on smoking do not clearly demonstrate the relationship between this habit and incidence of glaucoma.

metadata.purpose: to evaluate the impact of 2 smoking bans on hospitalizations for cardiovascular disease in the spanish adult population.
metadata.conclusion: in spain, smoking bans failed to significantly reduce hospitalizations for ami, ihd, or cvd among patients  18 years of age. in the population aged  65 years, hospital admissions due to these diseases showed significant decreases immediately after the implementation of the comprehensive ban, but these reductions disappeared at the 1-year evaluation.

biomarkers: hyaline fibrous thickening of the alveolar septa
cysts in the thickness of the interlobar septa
metadata.purpose: to present a case of pulmonary interstitial fibrosis with cysts in a smoker and to explore the histopathological features and differential diagnosis of the cysts.
metadata.conclusion: the absence of an epithelial, vascular or lymphatic endothelial lining of the cysts suggests that the cysts were caused by pulmonary interstitial emphysema.

outcomes.name: hyaline fibrous thickening of the alveolar septa
cysts in the thickness of the interlobar septa

metadata.population: children prenatally exposed to toxic substances
metadata.purpose: to assess structural changes in the retina using optical coherence tomography in children prenatally exposed to toxic substances.
metadata.conclusion: toxic substances during pregnancy interfere in retinal development, with children exposed to tobacco showing the least retinal nerve fibre layer thinning compared to those exposed to alcohol and other drugs of abuse.

metadata.population: leon health area residents, associated with smoking
metadata.purpose: to describe the frequency, trend and geographical distribution of the incidence of tobacco-associated tumours in the leon health area, spain.
metadata.conclusion: tumours associated with tobacco increased in the triennial studied, especially in women. the different geographical distribution can be used as a tool to prevent tobacco consumption in the areas involved.

metadata.population: adolescents and young people using electronic cigarettes and partial tobacco combustion devices
metadata.purpose: to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of electronic cigarettes and partial tobacco combustion devices as a method of smoking cessation
metadata.conclusion: the safety of the vapor or fumes inhaled by users of electronic cigarettes and partial tobacco combustion devices cannot be guaranteed, and these devices cannot be recommended for smoking cessation due to contradictory results from clinical trials and meta-analyses.

metadata.population: patients with crohn's disease undergoing primary ileocolic resection
metadata.purpose: to assess the effect of smoking cessation on long-term surgical recurrence after primary ileocolic resection for crohn's disease.
metadata.conclusion: smoking cessation after primary ileocolic resection for crohn's disease may significantly reduce long-term risk of surgical recurrence and is associated with less use of maintenance therapy.

metadata.population: night entertainment venues in santiago, chile
metadata.purpose: to assess second-hand smoke exposure in night entertainment venues in santiago, chile, and evaluate compliance with the smoke-free law.
metadata.conclusion: smoking where prohibited by law was observed in 36% of the venues visited, with a median pm2.5 concentration 13 times higher than background concentration on the street.

metadata.population: patients with a new diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis

interventions.original_text: smoking was classified by primary care staff into never, ex- or current smoking

metadata.purpose: to study the association between smoking and the development of rheumatoid arthritis in the general population of catalonia, spain
metadata.conclusion: our findings confirm an association between smoking and the risk of developing rheumatoid arthritis. the effect seems to prevail in the long-term and even in ex-smokers for 2 or more years after smoking cessation.

metadata.purpose: to compare continuous subcritical water extraction and hydrodistillation for extracting essential oil from marjoram leaves.
metadata.conclusion: the cswe method is quicker, provides a more valuable essential oil with higher amounts of oxygenated compounds and no significant presence of terpenes, and allows substantial savings of costs in terms of energy and plant material.

metadata.population: children with atopic eczema born to professional working mothers
synergies_interactions_negative: possible allergic contact dermatitis provoked by the essential oils

interventions.original_text: chosen by the mothers for their child, from 36 commonly used aromatherapy oils, were: sweet marjoram, frankinsence, german chamomile, myrrh, thyme, benzoin, spike lavender and litsea cubeba

metadata.purpose: to test the hypothesis that massage with essential oils would help alleviate symptoms of childhood atopic eczema
metadata.conclusion: there is evidence that tactile contact between mother and child benefits the symptoms of atopic eczema but there is no proof that adding essential oils is more beneficial than massage alone.

metadata.purpose: to map the effects of extraction pressure and temperature on the yield of coloring materials from origanum majorana using supercritical carbon dioxide.
metadata.conclusion: similar amounts of carotenoids and 40% of chlorophylls and their derivatives were recovered from the supercritical fluid extraction compared to the ethanol soxhlet extraction.

interventions.original_text: flavours extracted from thyme, marjoram and rosemary

metadata.purpose: to study the effects of commercially available flavours of spices on the formation of phip in a model system.
metadata.conclusion: all tested products, independent of their pro- or antioxidative properties, increased phip in the model system.

metadata.purpose: to provide a brief overview of some important herbs in the turkish flora and their potential health benefits.
metadata.conclusion: studies on these herbs, including marjoram, have revealed that they contain powerful active components that might be effective for increasing human health and preventing cancer.

metadata.population: adult females of the german cockroach, blattella germanica l.
metadata.purpose: to examine the toxicity of marjoram oil and related monoterpenoids against adult females of the german cockroach, blattella germanica l.
metadata.conclusion: marjoram oil and the monoterpenoids described merit further study as potential fumigants or leads for the control of b. germanica.

metadata.purpose: to compare different extraction methods for determining essential oils and related compounds from aromatic plants and optimize solid-phase microextraction/gas chromatography.
metadata.conclusion: solid-phase microextraction was the most sparing to sensitive components and the most time-saving method for the rapid determination of aroma compounds composition in marjoram, caraway, sage, and thyme.

metadata.purpose: to investigate and compare the inhibitory effects of methanol extracts of three herb species on platelet adhesion, aggregation, and secretion.
metadata.conclusion: the methanol extract of origanum majorana at a concentration of 200 microg/ml inhibited platelet adhesion to laminin-coated wells by 40%, supporting its traditional use in treating cardiovascular diseases and thrombosis.

metadata.population: insecticide-susceptible and pyrethroid/malathion-resistant pediculus humanus capitis
metadata.purpose: to examine the toxicity of origanum majorana essential oil constituents against insecticide-susceptible and resistant pediculus humanus capitis.
metadata.conclusion: certain monoterpenoids from origanum majorana essential oil, particularly linalool, (-)-terpinen-4-ol, and alpha-terpineol, merit further study as potential pediculicides and ovicides for the control of insecticide-resistant pediculus humanus capitis populations as fumigants with contact action.

metadata.purpose: to develop an alternative gas chromatographic method for the separation and quantification of arbutin in origanum majorana and arctostaphylos uva-ursi extracts.
metadata.conclusion: the established gc method was rapid, selective, and demonstrated that arbutin could be screened alternatively by gas chromatography.

metadata.purpose: to develop and validate a gc-fid method for determining ethanol content in marjoram ointment.
metadata.conclusion: the gc-fid method is suitable for determining and identifying ethanol residue in marjoram ointment for routine standardization assays.

metadata.purpose: to determine the main odorants of marjoram and thyme in spices and microencapsulated powders using spme.
metadata.conclusion: the study identified the best powders in terms of quality by determining total and surface contents of compounds and percentage dependencies between encapsulated and surface aroma.

metadata.purpose: to analyze the chemical composition and fumigant toxicity of essential oils against ephestia kuehniella.
metadata.conclusion: marjoram and lemon oils were the most effective essential oils tested, with significant fumigant toxicity against ephestia kuehniella.

interventions.original_text: 50 mg/kg body weight, given orally for 30 consecutive days
100 mg/kg body weight, given orally for 30 consecutive days

biomarkers: mitotic index of bone marrow cells
functions: weights and cellularity of lymphoid organs
metadata.purpose: to evaluate the efficacy of egyptian sweet marjoram leaves in alleviating genotoxicity, immunosuppression, and other complications induced by cyclophosphamide in albino rats.
metadata.conclusion: sweet marjoram leaves, especially in the form of a herbal tea, may be useful as an immunostimulant and in reducing genotoxicity in patients under chemotherapeutic interventions.

outcomes.name: mitotic index of bone marrow cells
weights and cellularity of lymphoid organs

symptoms: mitotic index of bone marrow cells
weights and cellularity of lymphoid organs

interventions.original_text: essential oils blended with lavender (lavandula officinalis), clary sage (salvia sclarea) and marjoram (origanum majorana) in a 2:1:1 ratio was diluted in unscented cream at 3% concentration for the essential oil group.

metadata.purpose: to assess the effectiveness of blended essential oils on menstrual cramps for outpatients with primary dysmenorrhea and explore the analgesic ingredients in the essential oils.
metadata.conclusion: aromatic oil massage provided relief for outpatients with primary dysmenorrhea and reduced the duration of menstrual pain in the essential oil group.

metadata.purpose: to provide a comprehensive and updated discussion of the developments and applications of sfe in the isolation of essential oils from plant matrices.
metadata.conclusion: a comparison of the extraction yield and composition of the essential oil of several plants and herbs from lamiaceae family, including marjoram, is presented and discussed.

metadata.purpose: to investigate the essential oil composition of origanum majorana under different culture conditions and salt effects.
metadata.conclusion: the hydroponic medium offered higher essential oil yield than the greenhouse, with significant yield increase under saline constraint. major volatile components varied between conditions, with new compounds appearing in the presence of nacl.

metadata.population: third instars of cecidomyiid gall midge camptomyia corticalis
metadata.purpose: to examine the toxicity of 98 plant essential oils against third instars of cecidomyiid gall midge camptomyia corticalis using a vapor-phase mortality bioassay.
metadata.conclusion: all essential oils, including sweet marjoram, were less toxic than the conventional insecticide dichlorvos, with lc50 values between 0.61 and 0.99 mg/cm3.

metadata.purpose: to explore the antioxidant activity and health effects of common medicinal plants.
metadata.conclusion: medicinal plants, including marjoram, are valuable for their antioxidant activity and health-protecting effects, utilized in various industries due to their active chemical substances.

metadata.purpose: to characterize and examine extracts from herbs for their ability to inhibit dipeptidyl peptidase iv and protein tyrosine phosphatase 1b.
metadata.conclusion: greenhouse rosemary, mexican oregano, and marjoram extracts were the best inhibitors of dpp-iv, while commercial rosemary, mexican oregano, and marjoram were the best inhibitors of ptp1b.

metadata.population: participants with a history of neck pain and neck disability index score >10%

interventions.original_text: 3% concentration cream composed of four essential oils: marjoram, black pepper, lavender, and peppermint. For the control group, only an unscented cream was provided. For 4 weeks, all patients applied 2g cream directly to the affected area daily after showering or bathing.

metadata.purpose: to assess the efficacy of aromatic essential oils on neck pain
metadata.conclusion: the essential oil cream developed in this study can be used to improve neck pain, with the experimental group showing better results than the control group.

interventions.original_text: marjoram tea or a placebo tea twice daily

biomarkers: homeostasis model assessment for insulin resistance
metadata.purpose: to investigate the effects of marjoram tea on the hormonal profile of women with polycystic ovary syndrome
metadata.conclusion: marjoram tea significantly reduced dhea-s and fasting insulin levels, showing beneficial effects on the hormonal profile of pcos women by improving insulin sensitivity and reducing adrenal androgens.

outcomes.name: homeostasis model assessment for insulin resistance

metadata.purpose: to summarize the pharmacologic characteristics of pinocembrin and discuss its mechanisms of action and potential therapeutic applications.
metadata.conclusion: pinocembrin has shown anti-inflammatory and neuroprotective effects, with potential as a drug to treat ischemic stroke and other clinical conditions.

metadata.purpose: to summarize comprehensive information concerning traditional uses, phytochemistry, and pharmacological activities of sweet marjoram.
metadata.conclusion: sweet marjoram has been used for a variety of diseases in traditional and folklore medicines, and a wide range of pharmacological activities have been reported from this plant in modern medicine.

metadata.purpose: to assess the chemical content, antibacterial and antioxidant properties of essential oil extract from tunisian origanum majorana l. cultivated under saline condition.
metadata.conclusion: essential oils of marjoram inhibited the growth of most bacteria, with gram negative bacteria being more sensitive. compared to synthetic antibiotics, marjoram essential oils were more effective against e. coli, l. innocua, and s. enteridis due to their high antioxidant activity.
